storyInfo: There is much that Jessica needs to learn on the frontier.

attributes.content: It's stuck. I can feel its leg...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Pull it out.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Won't it hurt the mother?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: They're stronger than you think.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Alright, I'm pulling!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Pull!
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I wiped its nose and mouth clean. It can breathe now, but it's too weak to stand up and drink from the mother. What should we do?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Wait.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Ah, okay...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: ...No, it's still not standing up.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Well, it was born about half a month early, due to today's accident.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Carry it back. We'll have to feed it by hand for a while.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: What if... it never stands up?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Don't make any assumptions about its fate, Jessica. Like I said, they're stronger than you think.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Mr. Woodrow! We need you back at camp!
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Th-There's a fight!
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: You go first, Jessica, I need to get the burdenbeasts back into the corral.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Jessica? But things are pretty chaotic right now. I'm not sure if she—
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: Yeah, I'm not sure if I—
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: It'll be fine. Go. I'll be there right after I take care of these guys.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: But what if—
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Just go and see what's going on. You'll need to learn to deal with this stuff on your own sooner or later.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Do it! Give 'em the ol' one-two!
attributes.name: Onlookers

attributes.content: Man, that kick must've hurt.
attributes.name: Onlookers

attributes.content: Excuse me, gentlemen, please disperse.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: B-Be careful, Jessica. These guys ain't the type to look before throwing a punch.
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: No need to worry about me. So what happened? Why are they fighting?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I-I'm not sure.
attributes.name: Anxious Man

attributes.content: What do I do now...?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Leave it to me, I'll take care of this.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: (The crowd's too thick for me to go in directly...)
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Maybe I can get in from above.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: The girl quickly assesses her surroundings. Vehicles and low wooden houses, scattered fencing and scaffolds, and a tall water tower directly in the middle of the camp.
She quickly plots an unobstructed route through the scattered buildings.
She unwinds a rope from one of the tents, climbs one of the scaffolds, and uses the rope to swing to the central water tower.
From there, she has a complete view of the chaotic scene on the ground.
Looks like the brawl began with those two at the center. The rest simply went with the flow.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: So if I stop them, the others should settle down too.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: She leaps down and lands in the center of the crowd, lithely dodging an incoming punch before grabbing the attacker's arm and wrestling him to the ground.
Pinning her opponent, she takes a deep breath and shouts—
All of you, stop this immediately!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Let's sit down and talk it out.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: We should be helping each other out here on the frontier, not picking fights. We need to learn to accept our differences.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Hmph...
attributes.name: Angry Woman

attributes.content: Tch...
attributes.name: Angry Man

attributes.content: Ahem... So how did you two start fighting in the first place? You even dragged the rest of the camp into it.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Talk to me. Maybe I can help mediate.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Oh, you'll hear me out then?
attributes.name: Angry Woman

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: It all started two months ago...
attributes.name: Angry Woman

attributes.content: (Two months... Their grudge goes back that far? I should have noticed sooner.)
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: We were at the market together, discussing whether to keep fowlbeasts or burdenbeasts once we're married.
attributes.name: Angry Woman

attributes.content: Wait... you're getting married?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Darn tootin'! If we don't do it now, the baby will have to be born next winter.
attributes.name: Angry Man

attributes.content: So... you were fighting over whether to get fowlbeasts or burdenbeasts?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Yeah!
attributes.name: Angry Man & Woman

attributes.content: ...Is that really worth coming to blows over?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Of course!
attributes.name: Angry Man & Woman

attributes.content: I'm sorry, I'm still confused... Can you go into more detail?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: (Maybe it's more complicated than that... I should hear them out.)
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: A few fowlbeasts won't make us any money! We should be raising burdenbeasts!
attributes.name: Angry Woman

attributes.content: And I'm supposed to just leave you alone at camp while I take them out into the wilds to go grazing?!
attributes.name: Angry Man

attributes.content: You think I can't take care of myself?!
attributes.name: Angry Woman

attributes.content: No need to stand up, ma'am. Use your words.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Who'd worry about a woman who can take out a grown man with a single punch?!
attributes.name: Angry Man

attributes.content: Sir, you should sit down too...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Stop arguing and settle this the old-fashioned way!
attributes.name: Onlookers

attributes.content: Fight! Fight! Fight!
attributes.name: Onlookers

attributes.content: Just calm down, everyone... Er, what am I supposed to do here?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: You're just afraid I'll cheat on you, aren't you?!
attributes.name: Angry Woman

attributes.content: Where the hell did that come from?!
attributes.name: Angry Man

attributes.content: Folks, please, just sit down...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: (Don't fight anymore, please...)
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Then what are you on about?!
attributes.name: Angry Woman

attributes.content: (Oh dear...)
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Obviously it's because...
attributes.name: Angry Man

attributes.content: Er...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Seeing the fire in the couple's eyes, Jessica nervously clenches her fist and readies herself for the coming storm.
Because...
attributes.name: Angry Man

attributes.content: Because I'd miss you every second I'm away!
attributes.name: Angry Man

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Well, well, now ain't that touching.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: But while we're all being honest, there's another score that needs settling: the damages to the camp.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: What do you think, Jessica?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I... I just want to cry right now.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Jessica?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: They were only fighting because they didn't want to be apart... What am I supposed to do about that?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I just... I just...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Wah...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Hey now, girl, no need to cry... What do we do, honey?
attributes.name: Embarrassed Man

attributes.content: Look, we're not fighting anymore. Wipe those tears, okay?
attributes.name: Embarrassed Woman

attributes.content: See? We're holding hands!
attributes.name: Embarrassed Man

attributes.content: S-Seeing you two make up just makes me want to cry even more...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Here, a towel... Wipe your face.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Sorry, Woody... All I could do was cry...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Just take it nice and easy. There's still plenty you got left to learn.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I come in, and the first thing I see is Jessica crying. Go easy on the kid, no need to use harsh language.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: I'm okay, Miles... That's not why... I-It's because...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: It's fine, let it all out. So how's the fence coming along, Miles?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Made the mother and child a luxury suite with plenty of straw. The mom eats well, the kid eats well.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: Can I go and see the little guy?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: After dinner. It's already on the table. You're gonna tell us all about your heroic exploits today.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: I heard you swung right into the crowd on a rope and stopped the entire brawl.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: I-I learned all that when I was a mercenary. It just felt like the best course of action...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Well, the way I heard it, you sat there crying while they were going at each other's throats, and it freaked them out so much they dropped everything to cheer you up.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: No wonder your eyes were so red. So that's your secret weapon.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: I-I'm sorry, I couldn't control my emotions.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: They kept arguing over whether to buy fowlbeasts or burdenbeasts, and I didn't even know what to say... I could barely understand what they were talking about.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Maybe I could have stopped them sooner if I did.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: It's not like you've ever had the chance to learn this stuff. You're overthinking it. Next time there's something like that, just...
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: Just what?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Easy. Take out your gun and shoot it into the sky. That'll get their attention, I guarantee it.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Ain't that what you used to do in the restaurant back in the day, Woody?
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: Who else would I be talking about?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Well, it don't matter how you do it, as long as it gets the job done.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: What did you tell those people, anyway? They paid for the damages and dispersed without a word of complaint.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I told 'em they had a choice: behave themselves and stay in camp, or get out and fend for themselves in the wilderness.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I-Isn't that a little extreme?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Little ruckuses like that can get real messy if you get bogged down in the details. Woody has the right of it. Cut straight to the heart of the matter.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: I see... I've never dealt with a situation like that.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Maybe I should try Woody's method.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: But remember, you're not me. Don't go overthinking this.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: ...Yeah, I don't have half the experience that you do.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: That's not what I— Never mind.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Alright, no long faces at the dinner table. Help me set the table, Jessica.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Okay... one, two, three, four, five... there's one set too many.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Helena, I put the extra set back.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: That can't be right, I was sure I counted it out. There are five of us, so...
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: (Turns to the side)
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: Helena, I...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Old habits die hard, don't they...? Let's eat.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Come on, stand up little guy...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Woody is taking the herd out to the wilds next month. You won't be able to keep up like this.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Jessica? It's getting dark. You should come back.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Coming.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: That's what you said last time, and I didn't see you back until sunrise.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Is Helena asleep? I didn't realize... I thought she just made a mistake. I shouldn't have reminded her.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Still bothered by what happened at the dinner table?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: She's been so kind to me ever since I arrived. But I was inconsiderate of her feelings...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I should know just how much of a blow the loss of Mr. Leone was to everyone... Better than anyone.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Just come in. She's fine. It's not your fault.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Are you really going next month, Woody?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Yeah, the seasons wait for no one.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: But there's so much I still need to learn...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: It's just for two months. Everyone's here to help.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: But I didn't even notice the feelings of those close to me... How am I supposed to take care of the entire camp?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: If that's what you're worried about, I'll teach you more before leaving. But get ready, 'cause you'll have even more responsibilities going forward.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: That's fine with me... But you're already so busy every day.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: At my age, losing a few hours of sleep ain't no big deal.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Woody...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: If you have something to say, say it.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: You say you don't sleep much... but I didn't expect you to be up so early.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Well, here's the bad news: you'll have to be up at the same time once I'm gone. Make the rounds, turn off the lights, maintenance check... You'll have your hands full with all the little things going on at camp.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Can I... really manage?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Depends on how well you do this month. You haven't touched that gun of yours since you quit the mercenary life. Not rusty, are you?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I... practice in the forest every day.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Fighting out here is very different from what you're used to at Blacksteel. Your old methods won't work, and you won't have access to the same equipment and support.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: How do you do it, then?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Look ahead.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: It's dark... I can't see anything.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Look closer.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: That's...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: She squints, trying to see into the dark swamp.
Suddenly, she sees a little glint.
...Glass.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Some ampule bottles I got from a wandering doctor. See if you can hit them.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: She raises her gun, struggling to zero-in on the ephemeral speck of light.
Phew...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Good. Now the one further away.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Alright...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Gunshots, then the sound of breaking glass. Soon, there is only one last speck of light in the distance, almost impossible to see.
The girl holds her breath and prepares to fire the last shot.
Jessica...
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Are you really worried that you won't be able to do your job properly?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: If there's something you want to say, Woody, just say it.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I can't say this for 100% certain, but looking at you these past few days, I get the feeling that what you're really worried about is that you won't fit in.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: This is a very different environment from what you're used to. It's normal to have growing pains.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: For the past few months, you've been trying to act like an experienced Pioneer around the others in camp, and like an old friend around us old folks.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: But it's only been half a year since you came. Half a year since you met us.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Am I not expected to grow up quickly and fit in?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Growing up means becoming a better person, not a different one.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Life ain't a jigsaw puzzle. Fitting in ain't about filling the gap someone else left behind.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I don't think that's fair to me. You've seen everything I've accomplished so far.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: ...Then hit the last bottle.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Woody... You shouldn't jump to conclusions.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Let's finish the exercise first.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Woody...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Alright... We'll do it your way.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: She once again takes aim at the bottle, but her shots keep missing.
Suddenly, her pupil contracts, capturing the tiny speck of reflection from the bottle.
You missed.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: It was just one miss. I'll hit it next time.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Deep down, you know I'm right. The targets were set up to match your skill level. You should've been able to hit all of them.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: But you didn't.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Are you saying your words distracted me?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Do you deny it?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I'm worried, Jessica. Is your stubborn refusal to face your discomfort a sign of strength, or are you just embarrassed to admit that coming out to the frontier was a mistake?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Maybe you ain't really prepared to live out here. Maybe you just didn't want to stay at Blacksteel.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: The old man takes out a coin and tosses it into the air. It lands on the back of his hand, and he covers it with his other hand.
What are you doing?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Couldn't make up my mind. My heart wants you to stay, but my mind tells me you should go back to your family. So I'll leave the decision to fate.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Heads or tails?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: And if I guess right?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Then you can stay. But if you guess wrong, I'll have someone take you home.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: This is ridiculous. You have no right to make that decision for me.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: It ain't me. It's the coin.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: ...It makes no difference, Woody.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Make a choice. You know me. I say something, I mean it.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Alright...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: You're right, Woody. I felt frustrated.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I admit it. I wasn't ready. Life on the frontier is strange and unfamiliar.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Caring for burdenbeasts, fixing fences, raising foals... it's all new to me. All the skills I learned at Blacksteel mean nothing here.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Do you regret it, Jessica?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: No. I don't regret it, and I'm not leaving, whether that coin comes up heads or tails.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: No one is ever completely ready. The only thing I can do is tell myself not to be afraid, whatever comes.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I made a choice, and I intend to take responsibility. If I choose to stay, I'll stay. I won't let a stupid coin make my decision for me.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: And I...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I want to stay with you guys.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Just because your grandpa left you doesn't mean you have to find someone else to fill the void.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I'm sorry...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Jessica, you bonehead.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Woody...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: This is no stupid coin.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: The old man raises his arm, revealing the object on the back of his hand.
It is flat, round and solid, with a star etched in the center, gleaming in the morning light.
In Columbia, Pioneers give it to someone worthy of trust. Someone who will protect the camp from trouble and threats.
Th-This is your sheriff badge.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: It's yours now. You think you're not ready. I think you are.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: What...?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: The only preparation you need to face the future is to not be afraid of it.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: C'mere. I'll pin it on for you.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: ...Am I really ready to wear this?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Of course. You're willing to cry for a stranger. That means you're willing to fight for 'em.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I knew it the moment I saw you.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: ...I promise. I'll take care of everyone while you're away.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I mean it.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: She touches the badge on her chest, then suddenly hears a bellowing from the forest. The duo turn around and look towards the sound.
A herd of burdenbeasts emerges from the forest. At the rear is a tiny foal, its steps unsteady yet determined.
